Dictionary.Name: The Collaborative International Dictionary of English v.0.44

Definition.WordDefinition:
Lanky \Lank"y\, a. Somewhat lank; tall, thin, bony and ungraceful. --Thackeray. [1913 Webster]
The lanky Dinka, nearly seven feet in height. --The Century. [1913 Webster]

lanky adj 1: tall and thin and having long slender limbs; "a gangling teenager"; "a lanky kid transformed almost overnight into a handsome young man" [syn: {gangling}, {gangly}, {rangy}] 2: ungracefully tall and thin [syn: {gangling}, {gangly}] [also: {lankiest}, {lankier}]
